Sri Mulyani, Pajak, dan Anak SD
04 Nov 2019, 05:06 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Eduardo Simorangkir/detikcom

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati banyak melakukan tanya jawab saat mengajar murid kelas VI-A di SDN 01 Kenari, Senen, Jakarta Pusat. Menteri Keuangan di 3 periode pemerintahan tersebut mengaku terkesima dengan jawaban para murid sekolah dasar tersebut."Anak anak memiliki pengetahuan dasar yang baik namun tidak dikaitkan dalam sebuah narasi. Jadi kalau bicara saya tahu saya Indonesia, Indonesia memiliki banyak tetangga negara lain. Dan mereka tahu Indonesia dipimpin oleh seorang presiden dan tujuannya menyejahterakan rakyat, menciptakan keadilan, keamanan," katanya, Senin (4/11/2019).Sri Mulyani menjelaskan bagaimana mencapai tujuan negara dari sisi pengelolaan keuangan negara. Dia bahkan mengajak para murid bermain peran mengenai bagaimana mengumpulkan pajak dan sumber penerimaan negara lainnya.Sri Mulyani terkesima saat bertanya mengenai penting atau tidaknya mengumpulkan penerimaan dari pajak kepada para murid."Ada yang bilang nggak perlu bayar pajak, tapi lalu teman-temannya bilang harus bayar pajak. Saya tanya kenapa harus bayar pajak? Mereka jawab untuk kepentingan bersama. Itu solidaritas luar biasa yang keluar spontan dari mereka. Itu menurut saya pesan yang luar bisa dari sikap anak anak itu," ungkapnya.Sri Mulyani juga cukup kaget saat bertanya mengenai cita-cita para murid. Bahkan ada yang menolak saat diminta menjadi menteri keuangan."Mereka ingin jadi YouTuber, atlet internasional, pilot, pengusaha. Tapi fungsi itu penting dan itu dibutuhkan oleh kita semua dan mereka hargai itu dengan role playing mereka memahami bahwa ternyata untuk mengurus Indonesia harus bersama-sama," ungkapnya. Sri Mulyani, Tax, and Elementary School Children
Nov 04 2019, 05:06 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Eduardo Simorangkir / detikcom

Jakarta - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati frequently asked questions while teaching grade VI-A students at SDN 01 Kenari, Senen, Central Jakarta. The Minister of Finance in the 3 periods of the government admitted he was amazed by the answers of the elementary school students. "Children have good basic knowledge but are not linked in a narrative. So when I speak I know I am Indonesia, Indonesia has many neighbors from other countries. And they know Indonesia is led by a president and his aim is to improve people's welfare, create justice and security, "he said, Monday (11/04/2019). Sri Mulyani explained how to achieve the country's goals in terms of managing state finances. He even invited students to play a role on how to collect taxes and other sources of state revenue. Sri Mulyani was impressed when asking about the importance of collecting tax receipts from students. "Some said that there was no need to pay taxes, but then his friends said they should pay taxes. I ask why do you have to pay taxes? They answer for the common good. That is extraordinary solidarity that comes out spontaneously from them. That is in my opinion an extraordinary message from the children's attitude, "he said. Sri Mulyani was also quite surprised when asking about the ideals of the students. Some even refused when asked to become finance minister. "They want to be YouTubers, international athletes, pilots, entrepreneurs. But the function is important and it is needed by all of us and they appreciate it with role playing they understand that it turns out that to take care of Indonesia must be together- the same, "he said.
